alert.note: Alert for Dodge; Mower (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued May 01 at 2:42PM CDT until May 02 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Critical Fire Weather Conditions Tuesday For Parts Of Southeast Minnesota And Northeast Iowa... .Strong northwest winds will continue to blow Tuesday with gusts from 30 to 35 mph. Deep mixing will bring dry air to the surface and afternoon humidities will fall into the lower 20 percents, potentially even lower. Green up has started but fuels are still supportive of fires which could move quickly if ignited. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING FOR CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS ACROSS PARTS OF SOUTHEAST MINNESOTA AND NORTHEAST IOWA... The National Weather Service in La Crosse has issued a Fire Weather Watch for low humidity and gusty winds, which is in effect from Tuesday afternoon through Tuesday evening. * AFFECTED AREA...In Iowa, Mitchell and Floyd. In Minnesota, Dodge and Mower. * TIMING...Tuesday afternoon and evening. * WINDS...Northwest 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 23 percent. * TEMPERATURES...In the lower 50s. * IMPACTS...any fires that start could quickly move, spreading rapidly and become hard to control. Please heed any local burning bands.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
